com.twilio4j.twism

Interface TwilioStateMachineServlet.TwilioCallback

  • Enclosing class:
    TwilioStateMachineServlet<E extends java.lang.Enum<?>>

    public static interface TwilioStateMachineServlet.TwilioCallback

    A TwilioCallback is used only to execute some java code, and *not* return TwiML. Just like a TwilioHandler, you are passed the TwilioParameters object, giving you access to userParams, which can be modified and its state will be preserved in a cookie to Twilio.

    Author:
    broc.seib@gentomi.com

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(TwilioParameters params)
      execute() is called by any of the various "callbacks" that you can employ with Twilio.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(TwilioParameters params)
        execute() is called by any of the various "callbacks" that you can employ with Twilio. These are meant as one-way callbacks, i.e. you get a notification along with parameters, and you get to execute some code, but you don't send back any TwiML. In fact there may not even be a call in progress when some Twilio callbacks are made.
        Parameters:
        params - You are passed the TwilioParameters object, giving you access to userParams, which can be modified and its state will be preserved in a cookie to Twilio for the duration of the current phone call.
